reviews.sentence: NICE. Room was nice and clean. Staff was very helpful. We requested several items and they were delivered to our room very quickly. They have free wi fi in the rooms now and a mini fridge. I wished they had a microwave in each room. I would surely stay again if in the area. PS do not CATCH THE FERRY OVER TO JOES CRAB SHACK. THEY ARE CLOSED.

Overnight. Super views and service. Always a pleasure to stay at the Renaissance. Easy to take a little scenic walk along the water side or the quaint old town. Some good restaurants within walking distance. The Sunday morning brunch is ample and delicious.

Great location and wonderful hotel. The staff was so friendly hotel is beautiful and is in a wonderful location. Room was very clean and comfortable. Only stayed one night wish I could have stayed longer. Only a half hour from Virginia beach board walk.

Nice facility and view. Overall a nice hotel. Very friendly staff nice views of the river and nice bar area with decent food. Some small cosmetic issues. The bathtub spigot was not attached to the wall at all and the bed had a big dip in the middle that my husband kept rolling into and when I asked for a new blow dryer to replace the one that had a loose part in it they never brought one.
I loved everything from the room the staff and the guests themselves. I loved the architect and everything else. The view was priceless. Everything was perfect. I will stay again for sure.

Very nice hotel a walk away fromOld Town Portsmout. Excellent service from the time I drove up to the front door to check in to the minute I left. Loved the beds and the service. Used room service a couple times and the food was excellent.

ODU Family Weekend Stay. The staff were very polite and professional. Hotel was beautiful and well maintained. Beautiful water views. Only complaint is no complimentary breakfast. Breakfast is served at 139 per person.

The GEM in hiding. I was sent to Portsmouth for a 4 day conference training for work. I was to stay at the Renaissance Portsmouth Norfolk Waterfront Hotel. WELL I am extremely elated to tell you I wish I got there sooner. I was greeted by the most professional staff anyone could hope for. Even thought it was late night the clerk insured I knew where to eat within 5 minutes walk. I was on the 11th floor and she made sure I had a view. And it was a spectacular view particularly in the evening with the sunsets. 121. I took in one eater and was just as described by the clerk. Oh and she called to the room a few minutes after I got in my room to ensure all was ok I like the view and to ensure my comfort was cared for. Exceptionally clean room wonderfully appointed beds coverings. The only thing lacking would be a in room vault. The bath was oversized and I enjoyed the shampoo of Rosemary and Mint. Plenty of towels. The indoor pool and whirlpool was a great way to start the day. Wonderful deck here looking out on the ship building docks. 104F in the whirlpool and the pool was at a perfect 78 degrees for swimming laps to get in the morning exercise. There were large clean towels a on every station point. This is directly next to the work out area which was clean bright well equipped and for once ALL of the equipment was operational. The bar scene was very nice and the staff so willing to please. The Last call was not just shouted out but the lead bar tender made his way around and ensured everyone there had an opportunity to put in their last order. The bar food was excellent I did find that eating a table top to be better then at the bar. The bar is massive. I was also pleased to find that the parting garage had a height restriction of 10 feet and was well lighted and very clean. Further I found delight in the fact that the lady vacuuming the carpet made it a point to stop as I approached introduced herself to me and I her. She asked where I traveled from and how long would I be there. She was smiling warm friendly and told me that should she be able to make my staff better she would be delighted to help. If you smoke there are many well appointed areas outside for this. Just past the wonderful fire place nice to sit next to on those cool knights. When you return from you day out and about you are greeted at the front with cookies refreshing iced water lemon lime fresh fruit. What a nice way to come back from a day of toils. I will return here for fun with my wife. I found that city GEM that too many will pass by on their trips out to the east in VA.

Very Nice. Stayed here one night while visiting family. The room was nice clean and comfortable. The price was great but they do hit you up for 10 to park. The WiFi was real good in our room. We did not use any of the amenities so I will not comment on those but the staff we interacted with were very helpful and pleasant. The room had a great view of the river and city.

Enjoyable experience. This hotel is very convenient to the ferry which crosses to downtown Norfolk VA and convenient to restaurants and attractions in downtown Portsmouth VA. The parking garage was not extremely convenient to the hotel but valet parking was available. Nice amenities nice pool and hot tub and an above average fitness room. Beautiful views of Elizabeth River and Norfolk skyline. Staff helpful and friendly.

I hate to be negative but. I will start with the positives. The location is beautiful right on the water. The view from our hotel room was wonderful. The sheets and the room seemed clean. The rest of the hotel was really bad. They had a very large party so the next morning I thought they just had not had time to clean the washrooms and hallways but it was still like that that evening. Here is a picture of our towel bar in the room. The toilet got plugged and we had to call maintenance. The movie I ordered did not work properly and they did credit me. All and all I would not recommend this place. Surprised it is a Mariot.

Dirty carpets and TV very limited. Food not good in the only restaurant. Parking attendance not very respectful of customers. Chrged me for making a local call from my room phone. Btw the room phone did not work to make local calls. The manager was aware of the broken phones but had not replaced them.
The worst. Nothing. Everything. I paid for a king and got two twin beds. My room was dirty and smelled.

The hotel lobby and conference area is very nice. The rooms on the other hand feel dated and small. One additional concern we had was there was a fire drill but the alarm was not heard from the hotel room. That caused serious concern.

There was quite a delay over half an hour upon check in we had to wait some time to get into our room and had to ask again when we had not been called after 5 minutes as we were supposed to. This made me late to meet up with friends who I had only 2 hours to see so it was definitely unfortunate.

Desk staff unfriendly. Nice river views. Outdated decor and bathroom fixtures. Indoor pool ceiling had holes in it and paint pealing off it. Pillars we are missing ceramic tile in places. Hot tub only had one jet working.

Do n’t hold your conference here unles you are a small group. We were a conference of about 500. They also booked a 50th reunion and a business training event. They were completely overwhelmedThe front desk staff was surly and blamed me when I reported that housekeeping had skipped my room two days in a row. The do not disturb sign was out until around 1 pm on Wednesday and 10 am Thursday. Several members of our convention had their rooms given away to locals who also had events in the hotel. The front desk actually told them to ask other guests if they could stay in their rooms and then sent the people with confirmed reservations to a hotel all the way out by the airport forcing them to pay for taxis to get back in for the convention. Friends told me that housekeeping came into their room and emptied the trash and left towels but did n’t make up the room. The restaurant was completely unable to handle their own dining room and had to make a special shortened menu to try to keep up and even with a four item menu it still took 20 30 minutes to get served. It took almost 20 minutes for me to get a simple side salad. The fish and chips that were AMAZING on Tuesday with full filets fried with a delicate crust became overbatered soggy unidentifiable logs of fish by Friday. The only bright spot in the week was the bar staff Winston and the other bartenders were fabulous and the concierge room attendant was great.

Spring Break Drop Off. Booked a one night stay here for the purpose of dropping our kids off to spend a few days of their Spring Break with their cousins in Portsmouth and Great Wolf Lodge. The hotel is extremely nice. From the bell hop to the front desk and the restaurant staff they were all professional courteous and welcoming. We returned the following week to pick them up and were unable to book a room because there was no availability. We will definitely stay here every time we are in the area especially if the government rates are available.

The lobby looks pretty. There is a bar and a restaurant. The parking lot is a pay to park per day. Self parking is 10. Front desk staff is friendly. Room smells of body odor. Was woken up at 730 am till we left for the day at 1030 am with someone banging on the wall doing some kind of construction work. We did find the new cable boxes and remotes in the hallway. Looked as if they are replacing the old ones in all of the rooms. They have disabled the input selection process on the TVs. So do not plan on bringing anything like a gaming console or trying to hook up your laptop to the TV and having it work. We received no cleaning services. They changed the cable box and remote but did not bother to vacuum or make the bed let alone change the sheets. There was mold on the bathroom ceiling. The cause may be from the fan not working in there. There is an old yellow stain on the ceiling near the AC unit. Overall just plain disappointed. I am glad we did not pay the 200 a night that was quoted by going directly through the Mariot website. Half priced but still overpriced.

Gorgeous lobby entrance and ballrooms. Extremely friendly staff. Room had stain on carpet dust on shelves and in vents and stains on caulking. Bed was not comfy. it is not filthy just not 300 clean. Pool was cloudy.
